title: The importance of nutrition for children
description: Nutrients include protein, fat, carbohydrates, vitamins (A, K, D, E, B, C...) and minerals (calcium, magnesium, iron...) that play...
content:
Nutrition is very important for the overall development of children:

A child's IQ is closely related to the quality of the nutrition that the child receives in the first years of life. According to many studies, malnourished children have poorer learning ability than those raised with adequate and balanced nutrition.

Maternal nutrition during pregnancy also directly affects fetal brain development and the long-term development of young children. If the mother is undernourished during pregnancy, the fetal brain may not develop fully.

Nutrition affects EQ and personality:

Nutrition not only affects the development of the brain and intellect, but also directly affects the emotional index EQ. Children who are malnourished from a young age are more likely to develop autism, anxiety, and depression. Children's personality is also related to nutrition, children who are not provided with adequate nutrition in the first two years of life often show signs of shyness, inactivity, less communication and often do not know how to share with others.

Adequate nutrition helps children to be smart:

The quality of nourishment or the quality of nutrition (milk) in the first years of life will affect a child's ability to learn later. Many scientific studies show that children who are provided with adequate nutrition during fetal development and early life often have higher IQs or children with iron deficiency will be at risk of reduced cognition and achievement in children. school age. In addition, science also proves that children who are provided with adequate nutrition are more active, socially interactive, eager to learn and have better cognitive abilities. Therefore, parents should pay attention to providing enough nutrients, vitamins, minerals and nutrients for the development of the child's brain and body.

Nutrients from breast milk help increase the child's resistance:

Breastfeeding mothers who adhere to adequate and reasonable nutrition often have better milk quality, antibodies from breast milk will help reduce the risk of diseases such as diarrhea, respiratory infections, etc. The nutrients in breast milk can help prevent infections, allergies and protect babies from harmful bacteria and viruses, and support the infant's immune system.

title: 14 Fruits that make your baby smarter, moms need to remember
description: In order to help children become more intelligent, regularly eating fruit is something that parents must influence to feed their children enough...
content:
1. Mango

Mango is one of the fruits rich in nutrients that are good for the body. Mango contains large amounts of vitamins such as folate, vitamin C, vitamin B6, vitamin E, vitamin A,... along with some other micronulities such as iron, choline, niacin, potassium,... In addition, mangoes also contain small amounts of omega 3 and omega 6 fatty acids. Therefore, mango helps improve eyesight effectively, supports the development of the brain and many other uses.

2. Adcocado

Avocados are considered super fruits to help babies be smart thanks to their nutrient-rich ingredients. Not only does it contain many good fats that help develop the brain such as omega 3 and omega 6, avocados also have a relatively high content of protein, vitamins and minerals. This fruit contains many vitamin A, vitamin K, vitamin E, folate, choline, calcium, phosphorus and potassium. All of these vitamins and minerals are indispensable in the development of the child.

3. Watermelon

Watermelon is a watery fruit that cools well in the summer and provides many nutrients for the body that parents can not ignore on the list of fruits for babies. Watermelon is rich in vitamin C and vitamin A which boosts a child's immune system and improves their eyesight. Besides, this fruit is also a good source of B vitamins, calcium, manganese to help the child's skeletal system develop optimally.

4. Custard

Custard is a fruit for babies chosen by many parents because it is rich in protein and omega 6 fatty acids that are beneficial for the brain. In addition, custard contains many oxidizing compounds such as bullatacin, asimicin,... helps prevent worm diseases, reduces the risk of cancer. The source of vitamin C, B vitamins in custard has the effect of strengthening immunity, reducing nervous tension.

5. Sapoche

Sapoche is a fruit rich in vitamin C, iron, calcium, potassium, beta-carotene,... The iron content in siamese pink is second only to ripe papaya, if you eat 100g of siamese pink per day, children will absorb about 52mg of calcium. This fruit has an attractive sweet taste that supports children's brain development, height and improves vision.

6. Strawberries

Strawberries are a favorite fruit of many young children thanks to their eye-catching color and attractive sweet and sour taste. The abundant vitamin C present in strawberries helps improve a child's immune system against harmful bacteria. Strawberries also have high levels of calcium and phosphorus that enhance the development of the skeletal system. build healthy muscles and nervous system. In addition, strawberries contain folic acid that helps a child's brain develop better and is involved in the production of blood cells.

7. Blueberries

Some scientific studies have shown the effect of improving memory, enhancing brain activity, reducing the stress of blueberries. Blueberries contain high levels of vitamin K, vitamin C and manganese that stimulate new cells to grow, thereby reducing the rate of aging of the brain. Blueberries also contain other nutrients such as vitamin A, B vitamins, iron, selenium and zinc that help strengthen a child's immune system.

8. Kiwi

Kiwi is a sweet fruit, rich in vitamin E, vitamin C and other minerals such as folic acid and potassium. Every 10g of kiwifruit meat contains up to 9 mg of vitamin C so nutritionists encourage parents to add to the fruit list for babies. Kiwi also has relatively high levels of serotonin that stimulate the brain's memory and supports children to sleep better.

9. Pineapple

Pineapple is an abundant source of vitamin C for the body, which increases resistance and iron absorption. Besides vitamin C, pineapple also has many vitamins, beneficial minerals such as vitamin B1, iron, calcium, manganese. Pineapple has a sweet, fiber-rich taste that is especially good for the stomach and digestive system, effectively preventing diarrhea.

10. Bananas

Bananas are fruits rich in soluble fiber that are especially beneficial for a child's digestive system. Bananas contain many other nutrients such as vitamin C, vitamin B6, potassium and magnesium that enhance the activity of the brain and nervous system, thereby improving memory. In addition, beta-carotene - a pre-vitamin A substance also found in bananas has the effect of enhancing eyesight to help children have bright eyes.

11. Ripe papaya

Ripe papaya is the fruit recommended by many nutritionists to supplement in the child's mileage menu. Not only rich in vitamin A, vitamin C, in papaya also has high levels of vitamins and minerals such as magnesium, calcium, potassium, vitamin B1, B3, B5. This tropical fruit has an enzyme called papain, which helps improve a child's digestive system, effectively preventing constipation. Vitamins and minerals help boost the immune system and metabolism, while reducing the risk of cardiovascular diseases and colon cancer.

12. Apple

Apples are fruits rich in vitamin C and vitamin A that enhance vision and brain activity. In addition, apples contain boron that supports the development of the skeletal system. Apples are also rich in soluble fiber that benefits the digestive system of the child while helping to prevent constipation. The fiber present in apples also helps to clean the teeth and gums during the process of chewing.

13. Orange

Orange is definitely an indispensable fruit on the list of fruits for babies. This fruit provides an abundant content of vitamin C which enhances a child's resistance and absorption of iron, thereby supporting the activities of the brain. The white peel of oranges contains a lot of calcium, so parents should feed their children this whole part to supplement the nutrition of the child.

14. Walnuts

Walnuts are foods that increase intelligence and brain supplements for children. Because, walnuts not only help to supplement an amount of omega 3 but also help strengthen calcium for the young body, thereby supporting the development and improvement of the bone system, teeth. Walnuts also contain antioxidants that increase resistance, preventing the attack of bacteria in the wild for children to grow healthy. In addition, walnuts are rich in energy, full of fiber, fat, vitamins and other essential minerals for children.

Zinc as well as iron help strengthen resistance in children, reducing the risk of infections or infections such as colds. title: Note that children have a healthy digestive system on summer days
description: Every summer, when the weather is hot, the number of young children with digestive disorders increases. The choice of food so that children...
content:
The following foods deserve to be present in the daily meal so that your baby always has a healthy digestive system:

+ Sweet sweet potatoes provide many essential nutrients for the development of children such as fiber, calcium, iron, vitamins A, C, E ... It is also an ideal source of carbohydrates for the body. You can use sweet potatoes to cook porridge or grind into powder for your baby to weaning.

+ Bananas: In addition to the two most important nutrients, fiber and potassium, bananas are also energy-rich foods and rich in vitamin B6, vitamin A, vitamin C, vitamin B12, calcium and folate. No food is more perfect than bananas in supporting a child's digestive system. Besides, the mucus present in bananas helps prevent diseases of stomach ulcers. You should use bananas as dessert after meals or blends to make a car for your baby.

+ Carrots: It is not too surprising that carrots are always on the list of the best foods for children thanks to high levels of important nutrients such as folate, carotene, vitamin C, calcium ... In particular, beta carotene - will be converted into vitamin A to help children brighten the eyes, maintain the immune system and skin and hair health. Carrots after boiling can be ground into porridge flour, which is easy to digest and is a nutritious dish for babies.

+ Milk: You should continue to breastfeed your baby. Breast milk is the best food for the overall development of young children up to 24 months of age, since breast milk contains colostrum (cholostrum) to increase resistance and help children develop healthy.

However, in case you have difficulty breastfeeding completely during this period for special reasons, you should go to a medical facility to receive guidance from your doctor and medical staff.

Things to keep in mind so that your baby's digestive system is always healthy:

In order for your baby to always have a healthy digestive system, you need to pay special attention to the following:

+ Feed your baby properly. The right time to feed your baby is from 6 months of age. You absolutely should not force your baby to weaning too early because the digestive system of the child desperately needs time until the digestive enzymes are fully produced to get used to digesting and absorbing new foods in addition to milk. In the beginning, give your baby a snack, from little to medium, from thin to thick and gradually increase the portion until he is fully used.

+ Add fiber to your baby's meals. Fiber is one of the essential substances for the digestive system and should be present regularly in a child's daily meals. Fiber not only helps purify the food in the digestive system but also helps to get the waste left in the body out, helping your baby absorb enough energy and nutrients in the food every day.

+ Give your child the habit of drinking plenty of water. Drinking plenty of water is a healthy habit that helps reduce the risk of constipation. Therefore, you need to train your baby to drink water depending on their needs when the baby is just 6 months old. Getting into more water will help improve your child's digestive system while supporting the body's absorption and excretion.

+ Ensure food safety and hygiene when processing food for your baby. Undercooked foods are not present in your baby's daily diet. Because it can be home to a variety of bacteria that are harmful to resistance and health, as well as the appetite of the child.

 Contrary to the previous misconception that abstinence or feeding children rarely diarrhea for fear of "indigestion", mothers need to continue feeding their children to ensure enough nutrients so that the child does not fall into malnutrition. For children who have started eating miles, it is necessary to continue feeding children normal foods of the child, porridge, meat, vegetables, fruits, yogurt, fruits ... It is necessary to choose easy-to-digest foods, break up meals if the child has not eaten well, can still feed the child oil. Do not force your child to fast or feed only salt porridge, which will prolong diarrhea and malnutrition. When the child has reduced diarrhea and eating well again, the child will gradually increase the meal and add the amount of food so that the child can compensate for the energy deficit when suffering from diarrhea, helping the body gain normal weight and prevent malnutrition.

 In short, the digestive system is closely related to the overall development of the child, especially the brain. In addition to providing your baby with all the essential nutrients through daily rations, you also need to pay attention to your baby's digestive system. With the healthiest digestive system, children can absorb nutrients easily.

title: Provide water to children especially on summer days

content:
How is drinking water beneficial for your health?

Five minutes after drinking is water that has left the stomach, so it is recommended to drink water only ten minutes before eating or an hour after eating rather than drinking immediately after or during eating, since drinking while eating will dilute and quickly bring gastric juice down to the intestines,  It makes digestion difficult. Moreover, while drinking and eating, we will swallow dishes that have not been chewed thoroughly which is not good for digestion and absorption.

Drink water should be divided several times a day, not once too much. Even if thirsty should not drink too much at once it is best to take it slowly one sip at a time so that water has time to seep through the intestinal wall into the blood vessels and satisfy the thirsty needs of a body that is deprived of water.

What types of drinks are good for children's health?

Drinking water can be boiled tap water for cooling, filtered water, mineral water, bottled pure water, milk, fruit juice, vegetable juice, soup water .. They can be used every day.

The best drinking water for your health are:

 Fresh fruit juice: orange juice, tangerine, salad, cucumber, apple ... When drinking should not add sugar, this juice both provides water and provides vitamins and minerals to the body. This water eliminates fatigue, enhances brain function and healthys blood vessels, helping to circulate blood flow well in the human body.

 Vegetable juices such as legumes, zucchini, vegetable juice ... It is also very good for the body especially for children with TC- BP who are not afraid of gaining weight, but also have a cooling effect especially in the hot summer days.

 Unsalted soy milk: also a nutritious drink and feed that both provides water, provides calcium and other nutrients.

 Boiled vegetable water: is also very good for the body because of its supply of vitamins and minerals.

 The best drinking water for humans is natural clean water in vegetables, melted ice or artificial clean water.

To ensure health, we should boil clean water to cool daily, if drinking bottled water, we must choose reputable brands in the market.

What types of drinking water should be limited and should not be used in children:

 Mineral water: Drinking water contains minerals such as sodium, potassium, calcium, magnesium ... Mineral water, due to containing more minerals, must be used at the right time, the right object, not used indiscriminately, especially young children are not allowed to use mineral water containing high mineral content to make milk because the function of children is weak and cannot remove excess minerals from the body,  because the excess minerals will accumulate in the person and disturb the type of heart rate, hypertension, edema ...

 Carbonated soft drinks: it should not be taken because it can cause overweight obesity, or full anorexia in children some provide empty calories.

 Industrial fruit juices: high in sugar, mineral content and vitamins are less good for health, drinking a lot leads to overweight - obesity.

 Coffee, energy drinks: not for children to drink.

title: Top 8 foods that increase height in children
description: According to experts, nutrition is the most important factor determining height in children. Therefore, children must be provided with a full...
content:
Children need to be developed a scientific diet according to each age with the right diet to develop in a balanced way both physically and mentally. Deficiencies or excess nutrition can lead to unpredictable risks. Nutritional deficiencies cause malnutrition, on the contrary, excess energy causes overweight, obesity.

In order for children to develop maximum height, parents need to add the following height-enhancing foods in children to the child's daily nutrition menu.

Following height-enhancing foods in children to the child's daily nutrition menu

1. Milk and dairy preparations

Milk and dairy products are indispensable foods for children. As a familiar and favorite drink of the vast majority of children, milk provides an adequate source of calcium that promotes the development and health of bones and joints. Besides, milk and dairy preparations also provide proteins that help cell growth, which is beneficial in the development of height. Therefore, drinking milk every day is a very effective way to improve height.

2. Eggs

Eggs are extremely popular foods, also one of the most effective height-enhancing foods in children. In eggs there are many amino acids, proteins that are easy to absorb, support the activity of muscles and enzymes, promote the increase in height in the child.

Normally, a chicken egg contains about 6.3g of protein and a lot of fat, vitamin A, minerals, zinc, iron,... Necessary for growth. Especially for children of developing age, parents should add eggs to their child's menu.

3. Chicken

Besides eggs, milk, chicken is also considered one of the foods that help increase height in children. In chicken there is more protein, iron, healthy fats, faster height development and more supple bones. Chicken is also an easy-to-prepare food, attractive taste, can cook many different dishes such as chicken soup, boiled chicken, fried, steamed ...

4. Shrimp

Shrimp is a food with an extremely high calcium content, one of the nutrients that promote bone development in children. An average of 100g of shrimp can supplement up to 1,120 mg of calcium, which helps strong bones and grow well, promoting maximum growth height.

5. Fish 

Fish is one of the foods that increases height in children very well, especially salmon and tuna – a rich supply of vitamin D and protein. Eating a lot of salmon at puberty will help develop maximum height. Parents can prepare dishes with fish such as steamed fish, fried fish, fish sauce ... To enrich your child's daily menu.

6. Cereals

Whole grains are high in B vitamins and iron. The nutrients in whole grains can improve the development and metabolism of the body. In addition, this is a food that contains abundant amounts of energy and a lot of fiber and magnesium content. A child's development needs calories and cereals are the right source.

7. Oats

This type of food that increases height in children is recommended in standard nutrition towers as well as nutrition towers for other special subjects. Oats contain a lot of protein and low in fat so it is very good for a child's physical development. Parents can use oatmeal to make a variety of dishes: Oat porridge, oatcakes, oat yogurt.

8. Soybeans

Soy is a familiar food in the daily life of every family. With a cool, medium sweetness, soy milk is loved by many people. However, not everyone knows that soy is the most protein-rich of plant-based foods, in addition to having a large protein and mineral content. If you want your child to improve his height quickly, don't forget to add soy to your child's daily nutrition menu.

In summary, to help children develop maximum height, parents need to pay attention to adding adequate nutrients as well as height-increasing foods in children to the nutrition menu every day.

title: Top 10 calcium supplements for babies
description: Choosing the right calcium-rich foods for your baby to ensure good health and well-being is very important. The article would like to...
content:
Foods rich in calcium for babies

1. Milk and dairy products

Milk brings a lot of health benefits, in addition to important nutrients such as potassium, protein, vitamins A, D and B12, etc. Milk and dairy products are very good calcium supplements for babies.

The body absorbs calcium in dairy products more easily than calcium from other sources. Mothers should include at least one serving of dairy products each day in their child's diet. If your child doesn't like milk, you can substitute it with yogurt and cheese.

2. Soybeans

Soy is another calcium rich baby food that can be added to the daily diet. You can use soy products like soy milk, soy yogurt, and tofu to make delicious, age-appropriate recipes.

Soy milk is also a good alternative for children with lactose intolerance. Adding soy to a child's diet also ensures a healthy dose of iron, fiber and minerals like phosphorus, magnesium and thiamin. However, not all soy milk is a good source of calcium, so it's best to check the information on the product packaging.

3. Green beans

Chickpeas and lentils are an important source of calcium for babies. They are also rich in vitamin A, vitamin E, vitamin C, fiber, polyunsaturated fatty acids, magnesium, potassium, iron and folate and have a decent amount of calcium.

Chickpeas are easily available and can be cooked in a variety of ways to provide the nutrition children need. You can cook it in the form of a curry or make interesting recipes like rolls, cheese beans, bean porridge.

Green beans can also be eaten with snacks like carrots and cucumbers. Chickpea curry is also a delicious way to incorporate this legume into your child's diet.

4. Fish

Most canned fish like salmon, sardines, and tuna are among the top foods for calcium, so don't hesitate to give any of these to your child.

In addition to being rich in protein and omega-6 fatty acids, these fish are high in bone calcium. Children can have fish bone soup, fried fish, steamed fish or fish sandwiches. Topping them with some cheese would also be delicious. You can also prepare fish for children to eat in the form of cotton balls.

5. Fruits

Fruits like papaya and dried figs are also great sources of calcium for babies. Dried figs can be eaten alone or added to milk or yogurt. Papayas can be eaten whole or added to desserts like custards and puddings.

Besides, one medium orange can provide 50 mg of calcium for your child. You can give your child an orange or orange juice as it is not only rich in calcium but also contains a lot of Vitamin C, Potassium, Magnesium and Folate.

You should give your child fresh orange juice instead of fortified drinks. This way, your child will be offered unprocessed food made with fresh ingredients.

6. Nuts

Nuts like almonds, peanuts and walnuts are good sources of calcium for your baby. Almonds contain up to 228 mg of calcium per 100g. Nuts also contain healthy fats, vitamin E, magnesium, and fiber. In moderation, they are considered calcium-rich foods for babies.

Nuts can be left whole or sprinkled on other foods. They can be added to baked goods, salads or milkshakes. You can also give your child almond milk and almond butter.

7. Green vegetables

In the top 10 calcium-rich foods for babies, it is impossible not to mention green vegetables such as spinach, okra, broccoli, amaranth, French beans, bunch beans, etc. These are all calcium-rich foods for babies to eat. mile. Moreover, these green vegetables also provide fiber and other minerals necessary for your child's growth. Broccoli is actually packed with calcium and many other important nutrients.

Most kids don't like to eat green vegetables, but you can "disguise" vegetables and prepare delicious recipes like mixed vegetables, curries, chopped vegetables, grilled vegetables, pizza, etc. envelope. You can chop vegetables finely enough to make sure your kids don't throw them away and mix them into everyday dishes like macaroni, etc.

8. Fortified cereals like Total, Raisin Bran, Corn Flakes

Some other foods such as corn flour, wheat flour also contain abundant calcium components. Whole grain foods can be fortified with calcium. Carefully read the information on the label to see how much this mineral fortified food contains, helping you choose the right one for your child.

9. Eggs

Eggs can be processed for children from 9 months old and up to eat. They provide a large amount of protein and vitamins, and are also a good calcium supplement for babies, helping to build strong bones and teeth. However, every child may not be able to eat eggs; Some may be allergic, while some may not like the taste.

If the problem is with taste, you can make different recipes, but if your child has an egg allergy, it is better to avoid eggs. If you are still concerned about giving your baby eggs, you can consult your pediatrician.

10. Certain types of seeds

Seeds are also in the top 10 calcium supplements for babies that you should try, for example sesame seeds are quite famous for their delicious taste and can be added to salads, pastas, soups, sandwiches, etc. They can be used as the main ingredient in recipes or as a decoration for your child to enjoy and enjoy.

title: Exercises are good for children's moods
description: Giving children exercise is an extremely effective method of physical and mental training. The right exercise not only helps a child's mood...
content:
1. Children practicing yoga help ease anxiety

Exercises for children, including yoga, are good for a child's mood. Practicing yoga enhances the chemicals in the brain that help control stress. Even young children can easily perform the postures of yoga exercises.

2. Boost confidence through team sports

Children who exercise, especially team or group sports, can bring impressive benefits to their mental and physical health. Many studies show that children who play team/group sports build a better self-image and become more active, thereby improving their mood performance. When children are in a good mood, they want to be more active and exercised.

3. Martial arts – tame restlessness in children

Martial arts will teach children discipline and control themselves effectively. Martial arts is especially suitable and beneficial for children with a lot of energy.

A study of children between the ages of 8 and 10 with behavioral problems found that taking karate classes helped children become more adaptable and control their behavior. When children are able to control their behavior, it's easier for them to make healthier choices and decisions.

4. Regular exercises

When children exercise, they help produce large amounts of natural chemicals called endorphins, which have the ability to calm moods effectively. Exercise helps your child's mood for a long time because it's good for both the body and the brain. It helps your child's brain cells become healthier, especially the areas of the brain that control mood. Some experts liken children to daily exercise to a natural antidepressant.

5. Exercises that boost natural energy

When your child is tired of academic pressure, you can suggest a few exercise options that improve his mood, such as briming, jumping rope, or playing basketball.

Parents should also advise children to avoid drinking sugary soft drinks or energy drinks during exercise, as they can lead to unhealthy weight gain. In particular, the caffeine in these drinks can make children more anxious and irritable.

After exercising, children should take about 10 minutes of rest to help blood flow. This will help the child's body become refreshed, full of energy and regain its focus.

6. Mindfulness practice helps children relax their minds

When your child is experiencing stress and wants to look for food to calm this condition, you should suggest that your child try some mindfulness exercises to relax his mind.

Mindfulness exercises often focus on feeling your body's breathing and heart rate. In general, it takes a certain amount of time for children to get used to mindfulness, but through this approach will help them feel more relaxed after exercising, thereby helping to awaken their positive thoughts and help them make healthier decisions for their health.

7. "Party" dance after school

If parents are struggling to find a physical training method that excites and excites your child, you can let your child dance after stressful lessons. Music and dance will help children be physically active in moderation, not only bringing a relaxed mood but also helping to improve their health.

Every day, they only need to spend about 5 minutes on dance exercises to improve their mood.

8. Bring smiles to children with free exercise

If your child doesn't want to participate in guided or competitive sports, you can give them free exercises, such as jumping rope to music. This is also considered an exercise for children, both improving health and good for their mood.

title: How much should children exercise with age?
description: Regular exercise is necessary for everyone, including children. However, everyone doesn't have the same need for time or intensity...
content:
1. Activities, games and sports

When you talk about exercise, you tend to think of typical adult sports, the gym, power circuits, and the like. However, when it comes to children, you must also take into account other types of activities such as games, physical education, activities performed at school, or any physical activity performed in a domestic context.

That is, dancing at home with children is also within the acceptable level for young children. Also play races or tag in the park. However, it is important that other forms of exercise are more specific than part of a child's daily activities. How to practice a sport or perform a specific activity is guided and controlled by an adult.

2. Recommended exercise time for children by age

In addition to performing different activities, they must be carried out for a minimum of time. Taking into account the age of children, these are the periods recommended by the World Health Organization.

- Children ages 1 to 3: Young children should play actively several times a day, an estimated time of at least one hour daily.

- Children ages 3 to 5: The duration of activity must be at least two hours daily, between playtime, and adult-coordinated activities.

- From 5 years to adolescence: Physical activity should increase in intensity after 5 or 6 years, reaching a strong pace during adolescence.

Exercise time is important, as it is the best way for your child to strengthen your bones and muscles and increase your breathing capacity. For this reason, the World Health Organization also recommends controlling the duration of inactivity in children. For young children, the duration of inactivity should not exceed one hour, and for school children, the time of inactivity should not exceed two hours. Except for the time they spend sleeping.

3. How to encourage children to exercise

The best way to encourage your child to exercise is to exercise with them. Try to take time each day to do different physical activities with your child. In addition to going to the park every day for a walk, cycling, or enjoying a while playing motor games, try to create time to exercise at home. Dancing is a great exercise, all muscle groups are activated and endorphins, the happy hormone, are released.

Make sure your child understands sports as a game, having fun and enjoying the movement. As such, they will ask for themselves and it will become a habit to enjoy as a family. Playing sports with your child will help you improve your body shape. In short, time spent with children will be more quality and healthier for the whole family.

Being sedentary will limit a child's skills as well as their ability to enhance their heart, lung, and muscle health. It also contributes to the formation of a sedentary lifestyle in the future and can lead to obesity.

Here are suggestions on how you can turn simple activities into a quality exercise session for your family, especially for young children:

1. Go for a walk before or after dinner

Whether you go into town or just take a walk around the neighborhood, it should interrupt your daily walking schedule. To make walking more attractive, create small goals for the trip, such as looking for a cat sitting on a window or crossing a small up/down stairs together.

Invent interesting names for exercises like squats, push-ups and sit-ups, then do them together until the show returns. New York City physiotherapy therapist Peter Kofitsas, who performs the move with his two daughters, ages 4 and 20 months, said: "Call them the sitting-up princess or Bob the Builder. You can also play "coach" and lead your child to fun movements when the TV is playing promotional content.

title: Morning exercises for kids to start a new day
description: As we all know, daily morning exercise has great significance in terms of education and health for children, especially children of preschool age...
content:
1. Warm-up exercise

As always, at the beginning of the morning exercise session, we need to give the baby a warm-up exercise. This exercise is simple but very important to help the baby avoid cramps and muscle contractions during the next exercise. To start, the baby stands in place, rotates the wrists, legs, knees, and hips for about 3-5 minutes.

2. Spinning exercise

The baby stands upright, the feet are shoulder-width apart, relaxes the hands and uses their body as an axis to rotate the body to the right and left (note that the upright person must not change position, rotate slowly at first, then gradually Gradually increasing the speed will help relax the arms and shoulders.The time for this exercise at a kindergarten in District 1 is about 3-5 minutes.

3. Exercises legs, arms, hips

The baby stands up straight with his arms at shoulder height, first bend his hands so that his hands touch his shoulders, then bring his hands down to his hips and shake his hips at the same time, then his feet step 4-5 times and then turn around and finally laugh haha ​​so loud.

4. Circulatory exercise

The baby's legs are shoulder-width apart, his hands are raised above his head, then he bends down and his hands are crossed, finally release his arms and return to the starting position.

We instruct the baby to combine this exercise with breathing exercises, inhale when bending down and exhale when returning to the original position.

5. Hand rotation exercise

The baby's feet are spread out to stand shoulder-width apart, hands are raised above his head, then rotate both hands in a clockwise circle about 5 times, then switch sides and rotate counterclockwise.

6. Stick exercise

We will give the child a small stick, then the children will use both hands to hold the end of the stick, first raise the stick above the head, then bring the stick to the belly, and finally bring the stick down to the knee.

7. Abdominal shaking exercise

Baby stands upright, feet shoulder width apart and ears on hips, then shakes belly to the right, then shakes belly to left to rhythmic music.

8. Knee exercise

The knees are together, the legs are slightly bent, and the hands are on the knees, then rotate the knees in a circle to the left, to the right to the music.

9. Swing exercise

Each child will be given a bracelet by her, then will guide them to shake their belly to keep the bracelet from falling.
